abstract: Goldman Sachs C.E.O. Lloyd Blankfein is telling his employees to keep a low profile. The New York Post reported that the chairman has warned staff to avoid making expensive, high-profile purchases as the firm weathers a firestorm of public outrage.

lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs’ chief executve Lloyd C. Blankfein is telling his employees to keep a low profile. The New York Post reported that Mr. Blankfein has warned his top staff to avoid making expensive, high-profile purchases as the firm weathers a firestorm of public and political anger over outsize bonus payments.

headline.main: Blankfein Said to Tell Staff to Avoid Lavish Spending
